p: According to Martinez-Alvarenga et al. [ 93], the degree of glycation is influenced by the preparation conditions, with temperature being the most influential factor, followed by relative humidity and time, and with the molar ratio of the reactants being the least influential factor. In their study, they used temperatures of 50–60 °C, a relative humidity of 50–80%, heating times of 24–48 h, and molar ratios of the reactants of 1:1 or 1:2 [ 93].
